sections.heading: Overview
sections.content: Joining a course in AI Engagement Hub connects you with your instructor and classmates, enabling access to course-specific features and AI tools. This guide walks you through the enrollment process step by step.

sections.heading: Before You Begin
sections.content: Ensure you have the necessary information and access before attempting to join a course.

subsections.heading: Requirements
subsections.content: You must have an active AI Engagement Hub account. Your instructor must have provided you with a course access code. You should be using a supported web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge).

subsections.heading: Getting Your Access Code
subsections.content: Your instructor will share the access code via email, learning management system (LMS), or during class. The code is typically 6-8 characters long and may contain letters and numbers. Each course has a unique access code that doesn't expire unless changed by the instructor.

sections.heading: Step-by-Step Enrollment Process
sections.content: Follow these steps to successfully join your course.

subsections.heading: Step 1: Log In
subsections.content: Navigate to the AI Engagement Hub platform. Enter your email and password. Click 'Sign In' to access your dashboard.

subsections.heading: Step 2: Navigate to Course Join
subsections.content: From your dashboard, look for the 'Join Course' button in the navigation menu or on the main dashboard. Click 'Join Course' to open the enrollment form.

subsections.heading: Step 3: Enter Access Code
subsections.content: Type or paste the access code provided by your instructor. Ensure you enter it exactly as provided (codes are case-sensitive). Double-check for any typos or extra spaces.

subsections.heading: Step 4: Submit Enrollment
subsections.content: Click the 'Join' or 'Enroll' button to submit your request. Wait for the system to process your enrollment. You'll see a confirmation message once submitted.

subsections.heading: Step 5: Await Approval
subsections.content: Some courses require instructor approval before you can access content. If approval is required, you'll see a 'Pending Approval' status. If the course has open enrollment, you'll gain immediate access. Check your email for enrollment confirmation or approval notifications.

sections.heading: Enrollment Settings
sections.content: Understanding different enrollment configurations your instructor may use.

subsections.heading: Open Enrollment
subsections.content: You gain immediate access after entering the correct code. No waiting period or approval needed. You can start using course features right away.

subsections.heading: Approval Required
subsections.content: Your enrollment enters a pending state after code submission. The instructor must manually approve your enrollment. You'll receive an email notification once approved. Approval typically occurs within 24-48 hours.

subsections.heading: Enrollment Deadlines
subsections.content: Some courses may have enrollment cutoff dates. Late enrollment might require special permission. Contact your instructor if you miss the enrollment window.

sections.heading: After Joining
sections.content: What to expect once you've successfully joined a course.

subsections.heading: Course Access
subsections.content: The course will appear in your dashboard's course list. You can access course-specific chat features. Your AI interactions will be associated with this course. You'll see course announcements and resources.

subsections.heading: Initial Setup
subsections.content: Review the course syllabus and AI usage guidelines. Check for any required introductory assignments. Familiarize yourself with course-specific features. Set up your project workspace if needed.

subsections.heading: Notifications
subsections.content: Enable notifications for course announcements. You'll receive updates about assignments and deadlines. Important messages from your instructor will be highlighted.

sections.heading: Troubleshooting Common Issues
sections.content: Solutions for problems you might encounter during enrollment.

subsections.heading: Invalid Access Code
subsections.content: Double-check the code with your instructor. Ensure you're entering it exactly as provided (case-sensitive). Remove any extra spaces before or after the code. Try copying and pasting instead of typing manually.

subsections.heading: Code Not Working
subsections.content: Verify the code hasn't expired or been changed. Confirm you're enrolled in the correct institution. Check if the course has reached its enrollment limit. Contact your instructor for a new code if needed.

subsections.heading: Stuck in Pending Status
subsections.content: Allow 24-48 hours for instructor approval. Check your email for any approval requests or issues. Contact your instructor directly if approval is delayed. Verify your student email is correct in your profile.

subsections.heading: Can't Find Join Course Button
subsections.content: Ensure you're logged into your account. Check both the navigation menu and dashboard. Try refreshing your browser or clearing cache. Switch to a supported browser if issues persist.

sections.heading: Multiple Course Enrollment
sections.content: Information about joining multiple courses simultaneously.

subsections.heading: Enrolling in Multiple Courses
subsections.content: You can join multiple courses using different access codes. Each course requires separate enrollment. Courses will be listed individually in your dashboard. You can switch between courses easily.

subsections.heading: Managing Multiple Courses
subsections.content: Use the course selector to switch between courses. Keep track of different course requirements and policies. Organize your projects by course. Monitor usage and costs per course.

subsections.heading: Trial or Demo Courses
subsections.content: Some institutions offer trial courses for testing. These may have limited features or duration. Use the same enrollment process with the trial code. Trial courses may automatically expire.

subsections.heading: Course Transfers
subsections.content: Contact your instructor to transfer between course sections. Previous chat history may or may not transfer. Project associations might need to be updated. Verify access to correct course materials.

subsections.heading: Re-enrollment
subsections.content: If you were removed from a course, you may need special permission to rejoin. Use a new access code if provided by the instructor. Previous course data may be restored upon re-enrollment.

sections.heading: Getting Help
sections.content: Resources available if you need assistance with course enrollment.

subsections.heading: Contact Your Instructor
subsections.content: Reach out via email or during office hours. Provide your student ID and email address. Explain the specific issue you're encountering. Request a new access code if needed.

subsections.heading: Technical Support
subsections.content: Use the platform's help documentation. Submit a support ticket for technical issues. Include screenshots of any error messages. Provide your browser and operating system details.

subsections.heading: Peer Support
subsections.content: Ask classmates if they're experiencing similar issues. Verify you have the correct access code. Check class forums or discussion boards. Connect with Student Assistants if available.

sections.heading: Important Notes
sections.content: Key information to remember about course enrollment.

subsections.heading: Privacy and Data
subsections.content: Joining a course allows your instructor to view your AI interactions. Your chat history becomes part of the course records. Enrollment data is protected under FERPA guidelines.

subsections.heading: Course Policies
subsections.content: Each course may have different AI usage policies. Review and understand the academic integrity guidelines. Familiarize yourself with model restrictions if any. Understand the consequences of policy violations.

subsections.heading: Withdrawal
subsections.content: You cannot remove yourself from a course directly. Contact your instructor to request removal. Course data may be retained for academic records. Withdrawal doesn't delete your chat history.
